title: Training on Fact-Checking & Digital Verification
description: I discussed how election misinformation shapes voter choices, citing global post-election research.
fullDescription: Ahead of Bangladesh’s upcoming 13th National Parliamentary Election, the Press Institute of Bangladesh (PIB) organized a two-day training program on 'Election-time Journalism' for around 50 journalists based in Dhaka, held on 16–17 January 2026. I spent some time with the participants discussing fact-checking. I started my part by explaining how misinformation and disinformation during elections can influence voters’ decisions about candidates, and who spreads such information and to what extent. For this, I referred to survey data and findings from different countries conducted after elections.

title: Training on Open source intelligence (OSINT)
description: I led an OSINT-focused fact-checking session at PIB’s Digital Media Training Program (19–21 Nov 2025).
fullDescription: I had the opportunity to take a fact-checking session at a two-day Digital Media Training Program organized by the Press Institute Bangladesh (PIB), held on 19–21 November 2025. In my session, I focused on the OSINT (Open-Source Intelligence) part—showing how publicly available information can be used to verify claims, trace misinformation, and support responsible journalism.
